data.title: INTRODUCING: LEMONDAZE — VOCAL GIRLS
data.meta_description: With the recent release of their debut EP, we caught up with rising shoegazers, Lemondaze.
data.text:
With the recent release of their debut EP, we caught up with rising shoegazers Lemondaze.

North-London based threesome Lemondaze dropped their debut four-track EP 'Celestial Bodies' just a couple of days ago, and it's one you definitely do not want to sleep on. Heavily drawing influence from the nineties, the EP is dark, grungy and full of angst. It's the perfect mix of nineties-inspired haze blended with modern-day musical hypnosis: swirly guitars, plenty of delay and lots and lots of reverb! What's not to love?

Having gained praise from some of their idols, including Ellie Rowsell of Wolf Alice and Rachel Goswell of Slowdive, it's clear that Lemondaze is a band worth watching!

Lemondaze is Isis De Chastelain, Rosie Heard-Edwards, and Jonty Freeman.

How do you describe your music in three words?

Isis: Hazey, intense, atmospheric

Rosie: dreamy, dark, loud

Where are you from - and what’s the best and worst thing about the place?

We're from Cambridge!!

Worst thing: The regal wetherspoon

Best thing: The free roaming cows

If you had to attribute one thing that’s responsible for getting you into music (whether that be a person, moment, artist etc) what would it be?

Rosie: The Slowdive Pitchfork documentary

Isis: S club 7

What are most of your lyrics centred around?

Rosie: Spacey-o

Isis: Space and lesbianism

Most ‘pinch yourself’ moment so far?

This

What’s the first song of yours that people should listen to and why?

Rosie: Art Form, because we've only got 2 songs out and this is my favourite

Isis: Defo Art Form, it’s my fave song of ours atm

The three main artist inspirations for your music?

Rosie: Curve, Wolf Alice and SPC ECO

Isis: Slowdive, Wolf Alice and Curve

What’s your band/ artist aesthetic?

Rosie: It’s definitely a mixture, Jonty is more moody skateboard teen, Isis is bondagey scary and I’m more silky, sparkly and pretty dresses

Isis: I think we all have our own personal styles but I think we all gravitate towards the colour blue and we definitely love spacey and hazey stuff which our artwork shows

Other than music - what are you really passionate about?

Rosie: Photography and nothing else

Isis: This past year I have really started getting into drag artistry and I am obsessed with BIMINI BON BOULASH!! And also playing breath of the wild.

What would you have been if you weren't a musician?

Rosie: fashion photographer

Isis: Idk, something arty and creative I think

What’s the best song for lifting you out of a bad mood?

Rosie: Get Shaky - Ian carey project
